text: The script I saw in the sledgehammer image says it looks for a hostname in dhcp, and if it doesn't get one, then it uses getent to try to determine the name.  The problem I was having was that getent was returning an outdated hostname (one that used to be in DNS but that we had changed) instead of the proper one.
But I'm not familiar with how getent works, so I wasn't sure where it was getting that from.
